language.name: tokenize
language.title: Tokenize
language.description: Tokenize text payloads using delimiter patterns.
language.label: language,core

token.description: The (start) token to use as tokenizer, for example you can use the new line token. You can use simple language as the token to support dynamic tokens.

endToken.description: The end token to use as tokenizer if using start/end token pairs. You can use simple language as the token to support dynamic tokens.

inheritNamespaceTagName.label: advanced
inheritNamespaceTagName.description: To inherit namespaces from a root/parent tag name when using XML You can use simple language as the tag name to support dynamic names.

regex.label: advanced
regex.description: If the token is a regular expression pattern. The default value is false

xml.description: Whether the input is XML messages. This option must be set to true if working with XML payloads.

includeTokens.description: Whether to include the tokens in the parts when using pairs. When including tokens then the endToken property must also be configured (to use pair mode). The default value is false

group.label: advanced
group.description: To group N parts together, for example to split big files into chunks of 1000 lines. You can use simple language as the group to support dynamic group sizes.

groupDelimiter.label: advanced
groupDelimiter.description: Sets the delimiter to use when grouping. If this has not been set then token will be used as the delimiter.

skipFirst.label: advanced
skipFirst.description: To skip the very first element

headerName.label: advanced
headerName.description: Name of header to use as input, instead of the message body It has as higher precedent than the propertyName if both are set.

propertyName.label: advanced
propertyName.description: Name of property to use as input, instead of the message body. It has a lower precedent than the headerName if both are set.

trim.label: advanced
trim.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

id.description: Sets the id of this node
